titlestmt.titleproper: Preliminary Inventory of the Bund Freiheit der Wissenschaft records
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Dr. Hans Joachim Geisler, Lisa Miller, and Sally DeBauche

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2016-04-14T15:04-0700

did.unittitle: Bund Freiheit der Wissenschaft records,
did.abstract: Minutes, correspondence, memoranda, reports, financial records, press releases, printed matter, and photographs, relating to education in West Germany and reunified Germany, and especially to radicalism in German educational institutions.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copiesof audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Bund Freiheit der Wissenschaft records, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired between 1991 and 2010. An increment was added in 2011.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Increments may have been received since this finding aid was prepared. Please check Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/to find the full extent of the collection.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Bund Freiheit der Wissenschaft was established in 1970 in West Germany to promote academic freedom. One of the organization's main activities was the publishing of journals, pamphlets, and monographs on subjects related to higher education in Germany. The organization produced several of its own journals, -including Hochschulpolitischen Informationen, Moderator, and Freiheit der Wissenschaft. In addition to these publications, the Bund Freiheit der Wissenschaft also published numerous pamphlets and monographs of German scholars affiliated with the organization. The Bund Freiheit der Wissenschaft also hosted regular forums on topics related to education and higher education reform.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Minutes, correspondence, memoranda, reports, financial records, press releases, printed matter, and photographs, relating to education in West Germany and reunified Germany, and especially to radicalism in German educational institutions.
